node.display_long_description:
- Join the unstoppable Sisters of Battle, legendary warriors of the future and embark on a thrilling story-driven adventure set in the incredible Warhammer 40,000 universe

- Explore vast planetary installations, huge derelict space vessels and ancient expansive ruins, in VR for the first time.

- High octane, intense shooter action, face hordes of formidable foes from the dark forces of Chaos.

- Wield 12 incredible and powerful weapons including Chainswords, Plasma Pistols, Boltguns, Flamers, Grenades and Power Swords

- Employ spectacular powers that can turn the tide of battle

- Throw, catch, pass, dodge, free move and dual wield - total freedom to crush your enemies in VR

- Massive bosses and epic moments

- Co-op Multiplayer coming early 2020

latest_supported_binary.change_log:
An overview of changes in this update can be found below:

Controls:

New controls menu option added to change the sensitivity of primary stick teleport. Helping to reduce accidental teleporting whilst turning.
Added additional reminders that centering your view will recalibrate your height

Gameplay:

We have modified the following gameplay functions to make the game more challenging:

The player max health was reduced
The health regeneration delay was increased
The amount of health gained through regeneration was increased
Ammunition values and placement rebalanced throughout all levels

We have reworked enemy encounters in the following areas to smooth out gameplay:

Chapter 3, target selection and pathing after obtaining the Lasgun.
Chapter 3, the initial defence of the last bunker
Chapter 7, the bloodletter summoning room after the two blast doors
Chapter 7, the corridor to the final hangar

Added additional signposting for the airlock puzzle in Chapter 6 so players are better informed on how to proceed.
Faith indicators on your wrist have been updated and should now be more clear and intuitive.
Faith Push now more effective at pushing enemies/terrain

Graphics updates:
Quest 2: Anisotropic filtering enabled on textures to retain crispness
Quest 2: Dynamic frame buffer to increase the resolution 

Audio:
Audio: new voice line for epic shots added
Audio: new voice lines for Sir Conrad
Audio: Bolter sound levels and clarity improved
Audio: Clarity across all weapons improved
Audio: Music now plays on chapter loading screens

Bug Fixes:
Removed some additional collisions to stop bullets hitting invisible walls
NPC should now no longer jitter when they look at the player
Enemy pathing now checks if other enemies are on the way to their destination
The Lasgun should now be more reliable at close range
The Imperial Knight should no longer constantly fire when the player is escorting him in Chapter 9
Chaos Marines should no longer suddenly stop shooting the player mid-fight
Rot flies now move around more and are more dangerous
Warp Talons and Raptors should now run properly and be more accurate at mid-range
Height calibration should now properly support up to 2m height
Fixed a couple of misaligned doors in Chapter 3 and 4
Act of Faith: the user can no longer activate buttons with faith push
A flickering in the movement vignette was fixed
Enemy ragdolls now look more realistic and travel further

nodes.title: New update! 28th January
nodes.body_text:
We’re excited to announce our brand new update is ready to download and play on the Oculus store. This update focuses on gameplay improvements, addressing a number of bugs and audio problems called out in player reviews, we have also implemented some first stage work on improving the graphical fidelity of the Quest 2 version in anticipation of our larger-scale graphical update later this year.

An overview of changes in this update can be found below:

Controls Updated

- New controls menu option added to change the sensitivity of primary stick teleport. Helping to reduce accidental teleporting whilst turning.
- Added additional reminders that centering your view will recalibrate your height

Gameplay Improvements

We have modified the following gameplay functions to make the game more challenging:

- The player max health was reduced
- The health regeneration delay was increased
- The amount of health gained through regeneration was increased
- Ammunition values and placement rebalanced throughout all levels

We have reworked enemy encounters in the following areas to smooth out gameplay:

- Chapter 3, target selection and pathing after obtaining the Lasgun.
- Chapter 3, the initial defense of the last bunker
- Chapter 7, the bloodletter summoning room after the two blast doors
- Chapter 7, the corridor to the final hangar

- Added additional signposting for the airlock puzzle in Chapter 6 so players are - better informed on how to proceed.
- Faith indicators on your wrist have been updated and should now be more clear and intuitive.
- Faith Push now more effective at pushing enemies/terrain

Graphics updates

- Quest 2: Anisotropic filtering enabled on textures to retain crispness
- Quest 2: Dynamic frame buffer to increase the resolution

Audio updates

- Audio: new voice line for epic shots added
- Audio: new voice lines for Sir Conrad
- Audio: Bolter sound levels and clarity improved
- Audio: Clarity across all weapons improved
- Audio: Music now plays on chapter loading screens

Bug Fixes

- Removed some additional collisions to stop bullets hitting invisible walls
- NPC should now no longer jitter when they look at the player
- Enemy pathing now checks if other enemies are on the way to their destination
- The Lasgun should now be more reliable at close range
- The Imperial Knight should no longer constantly fire when the player is escorting him in Chapter 9
- Chaos Marines should no longer suddenly stop shooting the player mid-fight
- Rot flies now move around more and are more dangerous
- Warp Talons and Raptors should now run properly and be more accurate at mid-range
- Height calibration should now properly support up to 2m height
- Fixed a couple of misaligned doors in Chapter 3 and 4
- Act of Faith: the user can no longer activate buttons with faith push
- A flickering in the movement vignette was fixed
- Enemy ragdolls now look more realistic and travel further

Future plans over the next few months include:

- Significant visual upgrades for Quest 2
- Last Bastion Horde Mode
- Multiplayer Horde Support
- Achievements
- Rift Launch
- Further gameplay improvements
- Additional maps, content and events

Thanks to everyone who has shared their feedback with us so far, we look forward to hearing what you think of our latest update!

nodes.title: New Update! 11th Dec.
nodes.body_text:
Sisters of Battle, a number of community-reported fixes and improvements have been added in our latest update available now! Please read the following:

Controls:

- Smooth Turning Added - We have added a smooth turning mode for those who prefer this style. This is available via the comfort section of the settings menu.

Gameplay:

- Grenade Launcher - The grenade launcher projectiles now explode on contact with enemies rather than bouncing.

- Chapter 9 Boss Storm Bolters - Two of the Storm Bolters had inconsistent behaviours, this has been rectified to make this encounter more enjoyable.

- Power Sword - The Power Sword itself now glows with dangerous power

- Chapter 10 Enemies - The visuals of the enemies in Chapter 10 have been improved along with tweaks to their AI to increase their intelligence.

- Chapter 7 Boss - logic, visual effect and animation improvements to this boss encounter to make it more lethal and challenging.

- Chapter 2 Window - a shiny new window looking out to Belis Retani beyond.

- Chapter 6 Puzzle Refinement - improvements to the puzzles in Chapter 6 that help to signpost gameplay and readability.

- Score Tracking and Balancing - Inconsistencies between score tracking in campaign mode and level replay have been removed. As a consequence of this, we need to reset leaderboards to ensure a level playing field for those chasing top scores, we apologise for the inconvenience of this.

Bug Fixes:

- Environment Streaming Tweaks - to remove some environment pop in occurring.

- General Stability Improvements - a series of bug fixes and improvements to increase overall game stability. This includes visual fixes, nav mesh fixes for stuck enemies and minor bugs found by the community.

We will continue to refine and update the experience of Battle Sister based on community feedback and reports in future updates. We would like to say a huge thank you to everyone who has shared their feedback with us so far.

Happy Holidays from the Pixel Toys team!

node.reviewDescription:
Into a good shoot em up game.
I think the graphics could do with a bit of an update as even after the updates on the oculus quest 2 it still looks a little bit bad but I can see past that as I’m not the expert.
A few glitchy items here and there with things like holding a gun with 2 hands and aiming down the iron sights bits not experience with other shootings games on here.
The faith push is ok but works only 50% of the time and can generally get round the object in cracks in the map.
The pros are the story line is quite cool. Kept me interested and wasn’t looking for anything heavy. Bigger assortment of guns would be nice.
Shame there is no way to avoid being shot at. That needs to be improved.
Overall a good game and some nostalgia there from real like warhammer. Think it’s worth a purchase. For the price I think it’s over but I managed a discount so made more sense when the price was reduced
node.reviewTitle: Fun game for a first time VR player

developerResponse.body: Hey Ollie, thanks for your review and constructive feedback. Our next update will be a significant step up in graphic quality for Quest 2, we will continue to refine and improve the game to run smoother. Your feedback on faith push and desire for more weapons has been noted too!
